intro: Hieracium diaphanoides subsp. balanbanyae, commonly known as the Balanbanyan hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its daisy-like yellow flowers. The subspecies is distinguished by its pale yellow petals and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. It typically grows in sandy or rocky soils in open habitats. This plant is often found in coastal areas and is adapted to withstand saline and arid conditions.
